collection_holder_name: The History of Idaho Broadcasting Foundation, Inc.
pageContext.collection_title: The History of Idaho Broadcasting Foundation Audio Collection
pageContext.collection_description: The History of Idaho Broadcasting Foundation Audio Collection is a massive assortment of over 950 individual reel-to-reel tapes and audio cassettes from various Idaho radio and television stations. It also includes many tapes provided by individuals who were closely associated with Idaho broadcasting in some way. Audio content includes: \"air-checks\" of actual broadcasts", "commercials and station promos", "musical jingles for various Idaho radio stations, excerpts from taped interviews with newsmakers, as well as tapes of many complete news reports themselves.  There are also some glass and vinyl transcriptions and phonograph records of old radio programs, commercials, and taped musical performances performed by local school and churches. There are a number of tapes of historic broadcasts of Idaho radio and television stations, including the initial sign-on broadcasts of several Idaho radio and television stations.
pageContext.collection_notes: In most cases, the Foundation has possession of the actual original recording on disc, reel-to-reel tape, or on audio cassette. In some cases, we have a CD or DVD containing a copy of the original recording. In many cases, we have already transferred the entire contents of these tapes to a computer hard drive. We use Adobe Cool-edit software, and the tracks are stored a Mp3 files. These recording are, for the most part, un processed. However, some \"EQ\" or equalization may have been done to "clean up" the recording and filter out rumbling lows, or tone down hiss and excessive high frequencies. Our recordings are, in most cases, very clean and easy to listen to. In many cases they were made from \"master\" recordings that suffered little or no loss, despite their age. There are some records and transcriptions, as well a few original digital records of more recent events. Not all materials have been digitized, and some entire collections are awaiting transfer, and are therefore, still in the original condition we received them in.
